column1: "Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it." William Arthur War
"I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought; and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder." G.K. Chesterto
"'Enough' is a feast. Buddhist prover
"If you count all your assets, you always show a profit." Robert Quille
"Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things." Robert Braul
"As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words but to live by them." John F. Kenned
"Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has plenty; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some." Charles Dicken
"Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance." Eckhart Toll
"If a fellow isn't thankful for what he's got, he isn't likely to be thankful for what he's going to get." Frank A. Clar
"If you want to turn your life around, try thankfulness. It will change your life mightily." Gerald Goo

"Gratitude turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos into order, confusion into clarity...it makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow." Melody Beatti

"The world has enough beautiful mountains and meadows, spectacular skies and serene lakes. It has enough lush forests, flowered fields, and sandy beaches. It has plenty of stars and the promise of a new sunrise and sunset every day. What the world needs more of is people to appreciate and enjoy it." Michael Josephso
"Gratitude is a currency that we can mint for ourselves, and spend without fear of bankruptcy." Fred De Witt Van Amburg
"The way to develop the best that is in a person is by appreciation and encouragement." Charles Schwa
"He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has." Epictetu
"At times, our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us." Albert Schweitze
"The deepest craving of human nature is the need to be appreciated." William Jame
"Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough." Oprah Winfre

"Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn't learn a lot today, at least we learned a little, and if we didn't learn a little, at least we didn't get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn't die; so, let us all be thankful." Buddh
"Silent gratitude isn't very much to anyone." Gertrude Stei
"Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude. Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts." Henri Frederic Amie
"You cannot do a kindness too soon because you never know how soon it will be too late." Ralph Waldo Emerso
"When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around." Willie Nelso
"It is impossible to feel grateful and depressed in the same moment." Naomi William
"One can never pay in gratitude; one can only pay 'in kind' somewhere else in life." Anne Morrow Lindberg
"Things turn out best for people who make the best of the way things turn out." John Woode
"No one who achieves success does so without the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude." Alfred North Whitehea
"Piglet noticed that even though he had a Very Small Heart, it could hold a rather large amount of Gratitude." A.A. Miln
"Forget yesterday--it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow--you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift--today." Steve Marabol
"We should certainly count our blessings, but we should also make our blessings count." Neal A. Maxwel
"In ordinary life, we hardly realize that we receive a great deal more than we give, and that it is only with gratitude that life becomes rich." Dietrich Bonhoeffe
"The only people with whom you should try to get even are those who have helped you." John E. Southar

"I truly believe we can either see the connections, celebrate them, and express gratitude for our blessings, or we can see life as a string of coincidences that have no meaning or connection. For me, I'm going to believe in miracles, celebrate life, rejoice in the views of eternity, and hope my choices will create a positive ripple effect in the lives of others. This is my choice." Mike Erickse
"Gratitude also opens your eyes to the limitless potential of the universe, while dissatisfaction closes your eyes to it." Stephen Richard
"Gratitude and attitude are not challenges; they are choices." Robert Braath

"They both seemed to understand that describing it was beyond their powers, the gratitude that spreads through your body when a burden gets lifted, and the sense of homecoming that follows, when you suddenly remember what it feels like to be yourself." Tom Perrott
"Gratitude is more of a compliment to yourself than someone else." Raheel Faroo
"Keep your eyes open and try to catch people in your company doing something right, then praise them for it." Tom Hopkin
"In life, one has a choice to take one of two paths: to wait for some special day--or to celebrate each special day." Rasheed Ogunlar
"This a wonderful day. I've never seen this one before." Maya Angelo
